message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) because it focuses on improving text understanding and retrieval through a novel entity salience model. Additionally, the paper mentions experiments on two TREC ad hoc search datasets, which are commonly used in information retrieval research. 

The paper could also belong to the cs.IR (Information Retrieval) sub-category, as it specifically mentions improving ad hoc search accuracy. 

The use of distributed representations and kernels suggests that the paper could also be relevant to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category. 

The paper's focus on modeling entity salience and interactions between entities and words suggests that it could be relevant to the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category. 

Finally, the paper's use of end-to-end learning and its potential for improving search accuracy suggests that it could be relevant to the cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) sub-category.
